newsitem.title: RUSSIA: 40 mln Russians need humanitarian aid - Red Cross.
newsitem.headline: 40 mln Russians need humanitarian aid - Red Cross.

text.p: Up to 40 million Russians -- nearly a third of the population -- require humanitarian help because of poverty as their vast country shifts from communism to a market economy, a Red Cross official said on Wednesday.

"There are 30 to 40 million vulnerable people in Russia needing help during the country's transition," said George Weber, secretary general of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies.
He told a news conference the figure had been calculated on the basis of government statistics and the Russian Red Cross's research. It largely comprised the elderly, the homeless and the disabled.

Weber, who has been meeting government ministers and members of parliament during a visit to Russia, said his trip was partly aimed at focusing attention on the relief work of the Russian Red Cross, founded 129 years ago.
He urged the State Duma lower house of parliament to approve as soon as possible a law that would put the Russian Red Cross on a firmer legal footing in Russia.
The Red Cross is providing support to Russia's needy amounting to tens of billions of roubles, Weber added.
